5.17.21  7:40 pm   does perfectionism inspire music writing (or other things?)

5.17.21  7:15 pm   Bill, I'm having a songwriting crisis (again). I seem to periodically flit between complicated chords, interesting harmony and trying to write geoundbreaking crazy stuff and just simple diatonic stuff with powerful melodies, more focused on the emotional conveyance - squeezing as much emotion out of a simple idea as possible, rather than trying to convey something super-interesting and harmonically spicy. I have about 15 full tracks I want to record for some kind of release, but they're all so different - some are pretty wild and others are just 3 chord ABABCB style things. Is it wise to try to release them anyway as they are, or do you think that kind of thing won't sound cohesive. I can't tell which path I wanna go down and I'm panicking
5.17.21  7:00 pm   what picture did you map to the pants of the 3d princess man?
5.17.21  6:56 pm   is the title of your next song "make some shit up"?

5.17.21  6:34 pm   Hey Bill,

Some of my favorite artists write songs through "divine inspiration": An entire song just appears in their head, and they just write down what they hear.

      The stuff they come up with is so intricate, it's unbelievable that a human could come up with it.

     I feel like my methodical, trial-and-error approach to creating music is vastly inferior. I study my favorite songs' chord progressions, melodies, timbres, rhythms, etc., to see what makes a song "good", and I use these conclusions to aid me in my songwriting process. But I feel like the end result isn't truly original, not inspired by something "beyond this world".

When I sit down to make music, I feel like I'm forcing it. It doesn't feel authentic, and it doesn't sound original. I feel like I'm just ripping off my favorite artists. Part of me thinks that I haven't studied/practiced enough to convert inspiration into originality. I've only covered a few dozen songs i n-depth. Another part of me thinks that I don't have a creative/original mind, and never will.

I know that you aren't omniscient, and this isn't an easy topic. But I would be truly grateful for any advice you have for me, based on the thoughts that I'm having.

5.17.21  5:43 pm   So I've been doing that thing where I try and catch the musical ideas before they fly past and I forget them. But now what happens, is I catch maybe 4 bars and try to get them recorded, but by the time everything's recorded, the spark is gone and all I have are these four bars. Do I just need to work faster?

5.17.21  5:06 pm   One interesting thing about your website, Bill, is that "notebook" section is on the frontpage with major content pages (songs, videos) while some of your other major content is on either "other categories" (lyrics, instrumentals, questions) or on "other other categories" page (anagrams, jazz, improvs, reality videos). What is so significant about "notebook" that makes it worth a place on the frontpage?
